articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A NHS trust and hospital manager have been found guilty of health and safety failings over the death of Alice Figueiredo.
articles.title: Alice Figueiredo: We quit our jobs, sold our home twice and spent 10 years fighting the NHS

articles.description: The chancellor calls it a "landmark decision" but critics say the government will regret the move.
articles.title: Sizewell C nuclear plant gets £14.2bn government investment

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The future for EVs will inevitably involve China. But where does that leave the UK and Europe markets – and what of the questions around national security?
articles.title: China's electric cars are cheaper, but is there a deeper cost?

articles.description: A majority of papers lead with the chancellor's U-turn on winter fuel payments for pensioners.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: 'It was fuelish' and '£14bn for nuclear'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Hundreds of millions of people are not able to have the number of children they want, the UN warns.
articles.title: World fertility rates in 'unprecedented decline' - UN

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Crime gangs are using increasingly elaborate routes to traffic the drug across Europe to the UK, the BBC is told.
articles.title: Ketamine swapped for salt as smugglers exploit Europe loophole in booming market

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: More than 300 Foreign Office staff had raised concerns about potential UK "complicity" in Israel's conduct in Gaza.
articles.title: Civil servants told to consider quitting if they disagree with policy over Gaza

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A report says dads should be paid 80% of earnings and allowed six weeks off work when they have a child.
articles.title: Paternity leave in UK is outdated and unequal, say MPs

articles.description: Youths with their faces masked and wearing gloves could be seen throwing masonry.

articles.description: For the first time teachers in England are receiving guidelines on how they should and shouldn't use AI.
articles.title: Teachers can use AI to save time on marking, new guidance says
